quotes.author: George Orwell
quotes.quote: War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength.

quotes.author: Harper Lee
quotes.quote: You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view.

quotes.author: Jane Austen
quotes.quote: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.

quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.quote: All right, then, I'll go to hell.

quotes.author: Emily Bronte
quotes.quote: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.

quotes.author: Charles Dickens
quotes.quote: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.

quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quotes.quote: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.

quotes.author: Mary Shelley
quotes.quote: Beware; for I am fearless, and therefore powerful.

quotes.author: Herman Melville
quotes.quote: Call me Ishmael.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it.

quotes.author: Lewis Carroll
quotes.quote: We're all mad here.

quotes.author: Charlotte Bronte
quotes.quote: I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will.

quotes.author: George Orwell
quotes.quote: All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others.

quotes.author: H.G. Wells
quotes.quote: No one would have believed in the last years of the nineteenth century that this world was being watched keenly and closely by intelligences greater than man's and yet as mortal as his own.

quotes.author: Bram Stoker
quotes.quote: There are darknesses in life and there are lights, and you are one of the lights, the light of all lights.

quotes.author: James Joyce
quotes.quote: History, Stephen said, is a nightmare from which I am trying to awake.

quotes.author: Jane Austen
quotes.quote: It isn't what we say or think that defines us, but what we do.

quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy
quotes.quote: All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.

quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
quotes.quote: Not all those who wander are lost.

quotes.author: Virginia Woolf
quotes.quote: Mrs Dalloway said she would buy the flowers herself.

quotes.author: John Steinbeck
quotes.quote: Tell me about the rabbits, George.

quotes.author: Aldous Huxley
quotes.quote: Words can be like X-rays if you use them properly—they'll go through anything. You read and you're pierced.

quotes.author: Homer
quotes.quote: There is a time for many words, and there is also a time for sleep.

quotes.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
quotes.quote: The darker the night, the brighter the stars, The deeper the grief, the closer is God!

quotes.author: H.G. Wells
quotes.quote: An invisible man is a man of power.

quotes.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
quotes.quote: When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.

quotes.author: Franz Kafka
quotes.quote: As Gregor Samsa awoke one morning from uneasy dreams he found himself transformed in his bed into a gigantic insect.

quotes.author: H.G. Wells
quotes.quote: We all have our time machines, don't we. Those that take us back are memories... And those that carry us forward, are dreams.

quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes
quotes.quote: The truth may be stretched thin, but it never breaks, and it always surfaces above lies, as oil floats on water.

quotes.author: Victor Hugo
quotes.quote: He never went out without a book under his arm, and he often came back with two.

quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quotes.work: The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson
quotes.quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.

quotes.author: Sun Tzu
quotes.quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.

quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius
quotes.quote: You have power over your mind—not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

quotes.author: Laozi
quotes.quote: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.

quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin
quotes.quote: Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing.
